newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Product Swaps - Regrade down, gas oil up.
newsitem.headline: Asia Product Swaps - Regrade down, gas oil up.

text.p: Singapore jet fuel/gas oil spread or regrade edged down late afternoon on Wednesday on lower jet fuel physical trade late Tuesday, traders said.
"The regrade is coming in abit because of the increased offers and the bids are at lower levels," one trader said.
June regrade was last quoted at 50/60 cents down from Tuesday's 60/80 cents, brokers said.
Traders said the fall was partly due to the physical jet fuel trade on Tuesday at $25.00 per barrel, free on board Singapore, down from Monday's buying level of $25.30.
The emergence of fresh offers at the around the $25.00 mark has also affected sentiment, they said.
Gas oil swaps extended its early day rise on firmer crude values and buying interest from new players, traders said.
May gas oil swaps were last quoted $25.40/$25.50 per barrel, up from Tuesday's $25.10/$25.20, brokers said.
May traded earlier in the day at $25.45, they said.
The buyer, a Chinese trader who has storage facilites in Malaysia, bought a 150,000-barrel cargo from a European major at $25.15 per barrel for loading June 1-5.

On top of this, two 150,000-barrel cargoes were sold to a local trader at $25.50 per barrel. The same trader together with two other traders have bought almost 19 million barrels of gas oil since March 3.
Traders said these actions suggest that there is strong support in the physical market at the $25.00 mark and the swaps market is taking its cue from these moves.
Traders said the firmer prices were also due to stronger crude with June Brent last trading up eight cents to $18.5 per barrel on top of a 10 cent overnight gain.
Fuel oil swaps regained its early morning losses to last quoted unchanged from Tuesday $100.00/$101.00 per tonne.
